intro: Hyoseris tenella, commonly known as the slender hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hyoseris tenella is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
